text: Samantha Cristoforetti (born April 26, 1977) is an Italian European Space Agency astronaut, Italian Air Force pilot an engineer. She is the first Italian woman in space and until 2017, held the record for the woman with most time spent in space with 199 days and 16 hours. This record is now held by Christina Koch. Cristoforetti is also the first person in prepare an espresso in space. == Biography == Cristoforetti was born in Milan in 1977. She spent her childhood in Mal√®, Val di Sole, Trentino, Italy. When she was 18, she took a US foreign exchange program and attended Space Camp. On July 3, 2012, the European Space Agency assigned to Cristoforetti a long-duration mission to the ISS in 2014. == References == == Other websites == *ESA biography * *Samantha Cristoforetti at ESA website.
